Cover\nDirector\n The AI-native operating system and forward-deployed backbone for nonprofits\nTurning under-resourced founders into fundable, operationally tight organizations\n\n\ndirectorforgood.org\n\n\n[Your Name], Founder &amp; CEO\n\n\n\n2. Problem – Founders Are the Whole Leadership Team\nNonprofit founders are carrying 5 jobs on 1 salary.\nThey’re expected to:\nLead programs and vision\n\n\nRaise money (major gifts, grants, events)\n\n\nRun operations and finance\n\n\nOwn communications and storytelling\n\n\nManage staff, boards, and compliance\n\n\nWhen funding tightens and staff are cut, all of this collapses back onto one person.\n Promising orgs plateau at $300–600k or quietly shut down — not for lack of impact, but for lack of backbone.\n\n3. Problem – Downshifted Orgs (Beachhead)\nOur initial focus: orgs that already proved they can raise $400k–$1M.\nThese orgs:\n\n\nHave real donor and community relationships\n\n\nHave a history of 7-figure budgets or close\n\n\nBut in the current funding environment:\n\n\nThey’ve laid off staff\n\n\nThe founder is back to doing everything\n\n\nMany are considering shutting down despite strong demand for their work\n\n\nThis hits founders of color especially hard, as equity-era funding retrenches and flexible money disappears.\n\n\nThese leaders don’t need another tool. The Director Pod – Capacity Ramp (Lean First, Then Scale)\nPods scale from 4 → 8 → 16 orgs as the OS and agents mature.\nYear 1 – Lean “Proto-Pod”\nTeam:\n\n\nYou (Founder/CEO)\n\n\n1 Forward-Deployed Director (FDD)\n\n\n1 Finance Director (covering finance + ops)\n\n\n1 Founding Engineer\n\n\nCapacity:\n\n\nFDD deeply embedded with up to 4 orgs\n\n\nFinance Director builds cross-org finance/ops playbooks and workflows\n\n\nEngineer builds Director OS + first agents alongside you\n\n\nPhase 2 – 8 orgs\nMature core agents take on most repetitive finance/ops/reporting tasks\n\n\nSame FDD + Finance Director structure supports more orgs, with additional FDD capacity added as needed\n\n\nPhase 3 – 16 orgs\n2+ FDDs each focused on 4–6 orgs\n\n\nFinance/ops/development leadership scaled across all 16 using agents and standardized playbooks\n\n\nAgents perform the recurring work; Pods focus on relationships and decisions.\n\n8. Director OS – Product Overview\nOne pane of glass for an org’s backbone.\nDirector OS brings together:\nRevenue &amp; Relationships\n\n\nMajor gifts map and warm funder pipeline\n\n\nNext-best actions for key relationships\n\n\nRunway &amp; Finance\n\n\nLive cash forecasts and scenarios\n\n\nBudget vs. actuals visibility\n\n\nOps &amp; Compliance\n\n\nRecurring task engine (payroll, filings, renewals)\n\n\nChecklists and playbooks\n\n\nNarratives &amp; Reporting\n\n\nBoard decks and updates\n\n\nFunder reports and impact one-pagers\n\n\nData flows in from email, calendar, finance systems, docs, and existing CRMs so the OS reflects reality, not just what someone remembered to log.\n\n9. AI Agents – How We 2–4x Human Capacity\nSpecialized agents do the repetitive work; humans do the judgment.\nExamples:\nMajor Gifts Agent\n\n\nScans email, calendar, CRM for each org\n\n\nMaintains relationship maps\n\n\nSuggests outreach and drafts donor emails and meeting briefs\n\n\nFinance &amp; Runway Agent\n\n\nPulls accounting and bank data\n\n\nProposes categorizations, reconciliations, cash-flow updates\n\n\nRaises alerts on anomalies and runway risks\n\n\nOps &amp; Compliance Agent\n\n\nRuns recurring checklists (payroll, filings, renewals)\n\n\nGenerates drafts, reminders, and task lists\n\n\nBoard &amp; Reporting Agent\n\n\nAssembles board decks and funder reports from live data\n\n\nKeeps a “board-ready” view up to date\n\n\nPattern:\nAgents explore, compile, and draft.\n FDDs and Directors review, edit, and decide.\nThis is the same shift we’re seeing in engineering (Cursor/Devin-style agents) and customer ops — we’re applying it to nonprofit backbones.\n\n10. Economics – Why This Makes Sense\nDirector makes a serious backbone affordable and scalable.\nIllustrative comparison for a ~$500–700k org:\nRebuilding the traditional backbone:\n\n\nED: $100–150k\n\n\nOps/Finance: ~100k\n\n\nDev: ~100k\n\n\nComms/Program ops: 60–100k\n\n\nTotal backbone: $360–450k/year\n\n\nWith Director:\n\n\nED/founder: $100–150k\n\n\nDirector Pod (Year 1 pricing for early orgs): target ~$80–120k/year\n\n\nTotal backbone: $180–270k/year\n\n\nAs Pods scale from 4 → 8 → 16 orgs and agents automate more of the workflows:\nPod-level gross margins expand\n\n\nPer-org economics improve while keeping human leadership involvement high\n\n\n\n11. Why Now – AI Agents + Nonprofit Pressure\nTwo timing curves are intersecting.\nAgentic AI is production-ready.\n\n\n“AI coworkers” are already shipping in engineering, finance, and customer operations.\n\n\nA small human team can now manage far more complexity with agents doing most of the clicking.\n\n\nNonprofits are under structural pressure.\n\n\nOrgs that once had $1M+ budgets are losing staff and struggling to maintain operations and reporting.\n\n\nFunders are more selective and want grantees with credible backbones and visibility.\n\n\nDirector sits at this intersection:\n an AI-native backbone delivered by a lean, forward-deployed team to orgs that cannot justify rebuilding full in-house leadership.\n\n12. Go-to-Market\nWe start where we already have pull.\nExisting relationships\n\n\nFirst 2–4 orgs from founders and orgs you’re already effectively “directing.”\n\n\nDownshifted $1M orgs\n\n\nTarget leaders who have proved they can raise $400k–$1M but had to cut backbone staff.\n\n\nFunder collaborations\n\n\nPosition Director as a capacity-building line item that makes grantees more investable and easier to monitor.\n\n\nSales motion:\nShort diagnostic: map “today vs with Director” team and budget.\n\n\nDemo Director OS + agents and show what gets taken off the founder’s plate.\n\n\nClose annual retainers, expand the number of orgs and scope over time.\n\n\n\n13. Business Model &amp; QSBS-Friendly Structure\nAI-native vertical SaaS with embedded forward-deployed team.\nRevenue model\n\n\nAnnual retainers per org, tied to budget band and complexity\n\n\nLong-term goal: multiple Pods, each supporting up to 16 orgs on the OS\n\n\nCost structure\n\n\nLean Pods (FDD + Finance Director) supported by agents and product\n\n\nFounder &amp; Engineer drive product/agent development that compounds across all clients\n\n\nQSBS-aware design\n\n\nU.S. C-corp, building an active, product-centric operating business\n\n\nAssets are primarily software, data models, and operating infrastructure\n\n\nCompany is structured so founders and early investors can potentially access QSBS benefits (subject to their own tax advice)\n\n\n\n14. Team – Lean Year-1 Plan\nSmall, high-leverage founding team with 12 months of runway.\nFounder &amp; CEO (you)\n\n\nProduct vision, sales, fundraising, relationships\n\n\nActs as early FDD alongside hire as needed\n\n\nForward-Deployed Director (hire #1)\n\n\nDeep nonprofit ops + fundraising\n\n\nEmbedded across the first ~4 orgs\n\n\nFinance Director (hire #2)\n\n\nCovers finance + ops across the initial pod\n\n\nDesigns playbooks the agents will run\n\n\nFounding Engineer (hire #3)\n\n\nBuilds Director OS and the first wave of agents with you\n\n\nTarget raise for ~12 months runway (illustrative):\nLean team + non-people costs → roughly $800k–$1M\n\n\nEarly org retainers reduce net burn as you ramp to 4 paying customers.\n\n\n\n15. Roadmap &amp; Ask\nRoadmap\n0–12 months (this raise):\n\n\nHire FDD, Finance Director, Founding Engineer\n\n\nOnboard 2–4 orgs\n\n\nShip v1 Director OS and core agents (finance, ops, reporting, major gifts support)\n\n\nProve: 4-org pod with agents delivers clear revenue and stability lift\n\n\n12–24 months:\n\n\nScale pod to 8 orgs\n\n\nHarden agents and playbooks\n\n\nAdd additional FDD/finance/ops capacity as revenues justify\n\n\n24+ months:\n\n\n16-org pods on mature OS\n\n\nMultiple pods focused on key verticals (arts, youth, community, etc.)\n\n\nAsk\nRaise $800k–$1.0M to:\n\n\nFund 12+ months of lean team and product development\n\n\nProve the 4 → 8 → 16 org capacity story with real customers\n\n\nBuild Director into the AI-native backbone for the orgs that can least afford to lose theirs.\n\n\n\n",
  "totalLinesInFile": 535

The user wants a new Market Size slide with TAM/SAM/SOM format. Let me compile the data I've researched and create a comprehensive market slide.

Let me calculate:

**TAM (Total Addressable Market) - All nonprofit back-office spending:**
- Total nonprofit sector: $1.4 trillion
- Administrative overhead: 11.7-12.8% median = ~$164-180 billion
- But Director's TAM is specifically the market for back-office services/software for small/mid-size nonprofits
- Nonprofit software market: ~$4.8-5.5 billion
- Nonprofit consulting services: ~$6.67 billion
- Combined software + consulting for nonprofit operations: ~$11-12 billion

**SAM (Serviceable Addressable Market) - Small/mid-size nonprofits ($250k-$5M):**
- These represent ~8% of nonprofits (92% are under $1M, but many of those are too small)
- Let's focus on the ~$250k-$2M range which is the "downshifted orgs" segment
- Approximately 5-7% of 1.8M = 90,000-126,000 organizations
- If each spends ~$80-120k/year on backbone (Director's pricing) = $7.2-15B potential
- But more realistically, the market is the portion currently spending on consultants + software
- If 5% of the $11-12B software+consulting market serves this segment = ~$500M-$1B

**SOM (Serviceable Obtainable Market) - Year 1-3 realistic target:**
- Target: 4-16 orgs per pod
- At $100k/org average = $400k-$1.6M revenue in Year 1-2
- Scaling to 100+ orgs: $10M+ potential

Let me present a clean TAM/SAM/SOM calculation:


**TAM: $12B** - Total US nonprofit software + consulting services market
**SAM: $3.5B** - Small/mid-size nonprofits ($250k-$2M budget) back-office services
**SOM: $50M** - Year 5 target (500 orgs at $100k each)

Focusing on back-office operations, I'll break down the market potential by examining budget allocations and operational spending trends.

By concentrating on organizations between $250k-$2M budgets, I can capture approximately 28% of the nonprofit software and consulting market, which totals $12.2B.

My strategy involves penetrating 1,000 organizations over 5-7 years, creating multiple service pods to systematically expand market presence and demonstrate scalable growth potential.

The initial segment of 100,000 organizations presents significant opportunity. While current back-office spending averages $34k annually, I see potential to elevate this to $80-120k per organization by providing comprehensive backbone services.

Projecting conservatively, I'll start with one pod targeting 4-16 organizations, achieving $1.6M ARR by Year 3. The long-term vision extends to multiple pods serving 100+ organizations, with potential ARR reaching $10-20M by Year 5.

**Changes made:**

   - **SOM: $50M** - 5-year target (500 orgs at ~$100k/year, <2% SAM capture)

2. **`lib/pdf/deck-pdf.tsx`** - Updated PDF renderer to include the new market slide and renumbered all subsequent slides

**Key market data included:**
- 1.8M nonprofits in the US (1.5M 501(c)(3)s)
- 92% operate under $1M/year
- 68% now use AI (up from 58% in 2023)
- Existing solutions: $5.5B nonprofit software + $6.7B consulting market
- Sources cited: Independent Sector, Statista, NCCS, Google for Nonprofits Survey 2025

'animate-spin' : ''}&#96;} /&gt;\n              Refresh\n            &lt;/Button&gt;\n            \n            &lt;Button\n              onClick={() =&gt; setIsFullscreen(!isFullscreen)}\n              variant=\"outline\"\n              size=\"sm\"\n              className=\"border-gray-700 text-gray-300 hover:text-white\"\n            &gt;\n              {isFullscreen ? &lt;Minimize2 className=\"w-4 h-4\" /&gt; : &lt;Maximize2 className=\"w-4 h-4\" /&gt;}\n            &lt;/Button&gt;\n            \n            &lt;Button\n              onClick={handleDownload}\n              disabled={isGenerating}\n              size=\"sm\"\n              className=\"bg-white text-black hover:bg-gray-200\"\n            &gt;\n              {isGenerating ?
